cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 145 miles SE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest later today, then turning north-northwest on Sunday toward the Florida Keys and up the southwest coast toward Tampa Bay/Florida Big Bend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Lower Florida Keys then near Naples–Marco Island area, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Watch areas lie north of Fernandina Beach to Edisto Beach SC and west of the Aucilla River to Indian Pass FL (north of Tampa Bay).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Fernandina Beach southward around the Florida peninsula to the Aucilla River, including Tampa Bay; Storm Surge Warning from Volusia/Brevard line southward around Florida to the Suwannee River including Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, especially the Keys, southwest coast, and the west-central coast including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (70% probability) of sustained hurricane-force winds (≥74 mph) with higher gusts as the core passes just south then north of the port Sunday night–early Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge 5–8 ft above ground possible inside Tampa Bay and along the immediate coast, peaking near the time of the storm’s closest approach.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast totals 8–15 inches with isolated amounts to 20 inches, producing flash-flood potential in the Tampa Bay watershed.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous rip currents possible ahead of and during the storm.
